node.title: We asked ABC readers what they thought about the Melbourne Cup. Here's what they told us
node.alt: Three jockeys aboard three horses crossing the line in the Melbourne Cup.
node.description: Crowds are back at Flemington this year, but ABC readers still have strong opinions on whether Cup Day is a good thing or a bad thing. Here's what they said.
node.content:
["The Melbourne Cup comes around every November, but rarely has it come at a weirder time.\u00a0", "Crowds are returning to\u00a0Flemington Racecourse this year, but the issue of whether it's something to be celebrated or detested has grown more and more polarising in recent years.", "We knew you were going to have opinions, and you didn't disappoint. More than 1,110 readers told us what they think.", "
Some of you love it:
", "", "
Some of you love\u00a0the fashion of Cup day.\u00a0(ABC News: Brad Ryan)
", "
And others say it's cruel:
", "", "
Red Cadeaux\u00a0failed to finish the Melbourne Cup in 2015 after\u00a0coming second in 2011, 2013 and 2014. The horse was euthanased in 2015 because of complications after surgery for the injury it sustained in the race.(AAP: Tracey Nearmy)
", "
Some of you used to love it, but have changed your tune:
", "", "
Drinking is part of the Melbourne Cup culture, whether you're at Flemington or not.(ABC News: Margaret Burin)
", "
Some aren't against racing, but want changes:
", "*Cliffs of Moher was euthanased after breaking its shoulder during the cup in 2018, Admire Ratki\u00a0died in its stall after the race in\u00a02014\u00a0\u2014\u00a0one of two horses to die that year \u2014\u00a0and Verema was euthanased after breaking a bone at the 2013 cup.\u00a0", "", "
The Cliffs of Moher\u00a0was injured during the 2018 Melbourne Cup and was later euthanased.(AAP: Dan Himbrechts)
", "
But others are satisfied with the current regulations:
", "", "
Some readers had\u00a0no problems with the current Melbourne Cup day event.(AAP: Julian Smith)
", "
Some would watch it if whipping was\u00a0banned:
", "", "
Lots of readers had issues with the whips used in horse racing.(AAP/Racing Photos: George Salpigtidis)
", "
We heard concerns about gambling and drinking:
", "", "
Some readers said they did not like the gambling aspects of the Melbourne Cup, while others said they enjoyed it in moderation.(AAP: Joe Castro)
", "
